data.title: Prime Minister Thaçi meets with Prime Minister Matti Vanhanen of Finland – Zyra e Kryeministrit
data.text:
3 June 2010

Prime Minister Hashim Thaçi has met with Prime Minister Matti Vanhanen of Finland, in Helsinki. The Prime Minister and Prime Minister Vanhanen discussed developments in the South East Europe region and the bilateral relations between Kosovo and Finland. Prime Minister Thaçi and Prime Minister Vanhanen first had a face-to-face meeting and then a working lunch together with representatives of their respective countries.

Prime Minister Thaçi initially thanked the Finnish Government and people for their continuous contribution to supporting Kosovo as part of KFOR, EULEX and the ICO.

The Prime Minister briefed the Finnish Prime Minister on new developments in the region and on the progress that Kosovo is making in state-building and in fostering regional peace.

Prime Minister Thaçi and Prime Minister Vanhanen praised the bilateral relations between Kosovo and Finland and they expressed their joint readiness for strengthening these relations towards better utilizing bilateral interests.

The Finnish Prime Minister acknowledged Kosovo’s progress thus far and confirmed that he will continue to support Kosovo in its path towards integration into the Euro-Atlantic structures.

Prime Minister Thaçi, during the meeting, noted his appreciation for the hospitality that Finland has shown for the people of Kosovo, especially for those that sought shelter in Finland during the Kosovo War and other wars that took place in the region.

The Prime Minister invited Finnish investors to come and invest in Kosovo, assuring them of good business conditions and a friendly investment climate. Prime Minister Thaçi and Prime Minister Vanhanen of Finland identified areas of cooperation and mutual interest, especially areas in which Finland is known for its high standards, such as the environment, forestry and agriculture.

In discussing Kosovo’s European perspective, the Prime Minister mentioned that the upcoming European Commission Progress Report on Kosovo will reflect the good work of the state institutions in the 2010 reporting period.

In a press conference following the meeting, the Finnish Prime Minister re-emphasized the European perspective of the South East Europe region, adding that Serbia, in this context, is obliged to solve issues in its relations with Kosovo.

Last modified: July 31, 2022
